# Plot.ly

[Back to DuckDB Data Engineering Glossary](https://motherduck.com/glossary/)

[Plot.ly](https://plotly.com/) is a powerful data visualization library and platform that enables users to create interactive, publication-quality graphs and dashboards. It offers a wide range of chart types, from basic line and bar charts to complex 3D surfaces and geographic maps. Plot.ly supports multiple programming languages, including Python, R, and JavaScript, making it versatile for various data analysis workflows. The library excels in producing web-based visualizations that allow users to zoom, pan, and hover over data points for additional information. Its integration with [Dash](https://dash.plotly.com/), a framework for building analytical web applications, further extends its capabilities for creating dynamic, data-driven interfaces. For data professionals working with DuckDB, Plot.ly can seamlessly visualize query results, transforming raw data into insightful, shareable graphics that facilitate data exploration and communication of findings.
